title: Concave lens - finding f from object-image graph

content.question: When a candle is located a distance <math alttext="d sub c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math> along the principal axis of a converging lens, an image of the candle is formed at a distance <math alttext="d sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> from the lens. The graph shows the reciprocal <math alttext="the fraction 1 over d sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>d</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mfrac></math> of the image-lens distance as a function of the reciprocal <math alttext="the fraction 1 over d sub c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>d</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></mfrac></math> of the candle-lens distance. What feature of the graph is equal to the focal length of the lens?

choices.label: The absolute value of the slope
The absolute value of the reciprocal of the slope
The axis intercept of either graph axis
The reciprocal of the axis intercept of either graph axis

content.answer: The reciprocal of the axis intercept of either graph axis

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
